unit_learning_outcomes.description: Apply relevant language conventions to create meaningful intercultural encounters.
Develop comprehensive elementary level skills in reading, writing, listening and speaking in the Chinese language.
Identify, evaluate and deploy the grammatical structures of Chinese at elementary level.
Demonstrate an awareness of some language and language use, in both Chinese and in English.
Identify, describe and evaluate some aspects of Chinese-speaking cultures and societies.
Interpret and write comprehensive elementary level dialogues and texts in Chinese characters of topics related to Chinese society and culture.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Self study vocabulary list each week before new lesson and finish workbook exercise after practical as required. On campus students' workbook will be checked in practical class. Online offering students will submit proof of finished workbook each week to attend this activity.

data.description: This unit aims to further develop students' ability to communicate in Chinese through the study of language structure, language functions and cultural knowledge. More complex grammatical constructions will be introduced. Through the unit, students will also gain a greater understanding of various Chinese language and culture and have chances to compare the culture similarities and differences and between China and Australia. This unit is working towards HSK level 2.
